clinical_study.official_title: Intra-umbilical Injection of Misoprostol Versus Normal Saline in the Management of Retained Placenta: Intrapartum Placebo-controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Administration of intraumbilical misoprostol to women with retained placenta despite active management of third stage of labour reduces the need for manual removal of placenta and the amount of blood loss vaginally.

detailed_description.textblock: Retained placenta (RP)is one of the complications of third stage of labour; it should be managed promptly as it may cause severe bleeding, infection, maternal morbidity and mortality .The current standard management of RP word wide, by manual removal aims to prevent these problems, but it is unsatisfactory method because it requires general anaesthesia in hospital, It is an invasive procedure with its own serious complications of bleeding, infection and genital tract injury. Umbilical vein injection of misoprostol is a simple, safe method and could be performed at the place of delivery .

primary_outcome.measure: delivery of placenta by medical intervention
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after the injection of misoprostol or normal saline in the umbilical vein
primary_outcome.description: The administration of intraumbilical misoprostol to women with retained placenta despite active management of third stage of labour reduces the need for manual removal of placenta under general anaesthesia.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes after umbilical vein injection of misoprostol
secondary_outcome.description: using intraumbilical misoprostol in women with retained placenta reduces the amount of blood loss vaginally.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety and Tolabrity
other_outcome.time_frame: 2 hours after umbilical vein injection of misoprostol
other_outcome.description: Local applications of misoprostol through umbilical vein is associated with less side effects like shivering, fever, dizziness vomiting, flushes, nausea, abdominal pain and headache

arm_group.description: 4 misoprostol tablets (Misotac® 200 micrograms tablet) dissolved in 20 ml of normal saline injected to umbilical vein
Normal saline 0.9%, 20 ml was injected in the umbilical vein in cases of retained placenta

intervention.description: It is a synthetic prostaglandin (PgE1 analogue)used as a uterotonic substance.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- women having singleton pregnancy
- 28 weeks of gestation or more delivered vaginally
- prolongation of the third stage of labour (more than 30 min) following active management of third stage of labour
Exclusion Criteria:
- Who refused to participate in the trial
- Multiple pregnancies
- Previous Caesarean Section
- Haemodynamically unstable
- Severe anaemia (haemoglobin less than 8gm/dl)
- Chorioamnionitis
